render-kit.description: In the descriptions of the renderers, when we say "the value is passed thru", we mean that the name=value pair is rendered just as is. For example, if the Button renderer is rendering its UICommand component, and the component has a "type" attribute, we take the value of that attribute and render it as the right hand side of the "type" attribute on the "input" element. Passthru attributes are not checked for validity.
render-kit.renderer:
Renders an HTML "input" element. If the type attribute is specified it is passed thru un-checked as the value of the "type" attribute in the rendered output. If the type attribute is not specified, "submit" is used. Render the clientId of the component as the value of the "name" attribute. Render the current value of the component as the value of the "value" attribute. If the "styleClass" attribute is specified, render its value as the value of the "class" attribute. Button &button-renderer-class; &core-attrs; &events-attrs; &i18n-attrs;

Renders an HTML "input" element of type "checkbox". Render the clientId of the component as the value of the "name" attribute. If the current value of the component is "true", output "true" as the value of the "checked" attribute. If the "styleClass" attribute is specified, render its value as the value of the "class" attribute. Checkbox &checkbox-renderer-class; &core-attrs; &events-attrs; &i18n-attrs;

Renders an HTML "form" element. The value of the "method" attribute must be "post". The value of the "action" attribute must be the request context path, followed by the view id of this view. javax.faces.component.html.HtmlForm

Renders an HTML "table" element. Render the "header" facet, if present, inside of "thead", "tr", and "th" elements, nested in that order. If the "headerClass" attribute is specifed, render its value as the value of the "class" attribute on the "th" element. Render the value of the "columns" attribute as the value of the "colspan" attribute on the "th" element. Render the children inside of a "tbody" element. Render the children based on the value of the "columns" attribute, creating a new row each time a "columns" worth of children have been rendered. Render the "footer" facet if present, inside of "tfoot", "tr", and "th" elements, nested in that order. If the "footerClass" attribute is specified, render its value as the value of the "class" attribute on the "th" element.
Grid &grid-renderer-class; &core-attrs; &table-attrs; &events-attrs;

cellpadding java.lang.String
override width

renderer.description: Intended for use in situations when only one UIComponent child can be nested, such as in the case of facets. If the "style" or "styleClass" attributes are present, render a "span" element, outputting the value of the "style" attribute as the value of the "style" attribute, and the value of the "styleClass" attribute as the value of the "class" attribute.

Renders an HTML "input" element of type "hidden". Render the clientId of the component as the value of the "name" attribute. Render the current value of the component as the value of the "value" attribute.

render-kit.renderer:
When rendering a UIOutput component, render an HTML "a" anchor element. The value of the component is rendered as the value of the "href" attribute. Any child UIParameter components are appended to the String to be output as the value of the "href" attribute as query parameters before rendering. The name of the UIParameter goes on the left hand side, and the value of the UIParameter on the right hand side. Each UIParameter instance is separeted by an ampersand, as dictated in the URL spec. If the "styleClass" attribute is specified, render its value as the value of the "class" attribute. When rendering a UICommand component, render an HTML "a" anchor element. Render "#" as the value of the "href" attribute. Render javascript that is functionaly equivalent to the following as the value of the "onmousedown" attribute: "document.forms[FORM_NUMBER]['CLIENT_ID'].value='CLIENT_ID'; document.forms[0]['PARAM1_NAME'].value='PARAM1_VALUE'; document.forms[0]['PARAM2_NAME'].value='PARAM2_VALUE'; document.forms[FORM_NUMBER].submit()" where FORM_NUMBER is the number, starting at 0 of the form in which this link resides, CLIENT_ID is the clientId of the UICommand component, PARAM*_NAME and PARAM*_VALUE are the names and values, respectively, of any nested UIParameter children. If the "styleClass" attribute is specified, render its value as the value of the "class" attribute. Render any non-UIParameter children as normal inside of the "a" element. These will appear as the link text. Render an "input" element of "type" "hidden" for each of the nested UIParameter children, taking the name and value properties from each one in turn.
Link &link-renderer-class; &core-attrs; &events-attrs; &i18n-attrs;

If the "styleClass" attribute is specified, render a "span" element and render the value of the "styleClass attribute as the value of the "class" attribute on the "span" element. Render an HTML "select" element. Render the clientId of the component as the value of the "name" attribute. If the component to be rendered is a UISelectMany, render "true" as the value of the "multiple" attribute. If the "size" attribute is specified, render its value as the value of the "size" attribute. If the value of the "layout" attribute is "table", render nested "table", "tr", and "td" elements, in that order. If the "styleClass" attribute is specified, render a "span" element and render the value of the "styleClass attribute as the value of the "class" attribute on the "span" element. Render a "table" element. If the "border" attribute is specified, pass it thru. If the "layout" attribute is specified, and its value is "PAGE_DIRECTION", render the children elements vertically, otherwise horizontally, in the table. If any of the children are an instance of SelectItemGroup, render them as a nested table. Each of the children are ultimately rendererd as an "input" element of "type" "radio". If the value of the currently rendered child is equal to the value of the parent UISelectOne, render the "checked" attribute with the value of "true" for that "input" element. If the "disabled" attribute is specified, pass its value thru. Radio &radio-renderer-class;

javax.faces.component.html.HtmlInputSecret

If the "styleClass" attribute is specified, render a "span" element and render the value of the "styleClass attribute as the value of the "class" attribute on the "span" element. Render a "table" element. If the "border" attribute is specified, pass it thru. If the "layout" attribute is specified, and its value is "PAGE_DIRECTION", render the children elements vertically, otherwise horizontally, in the table. If any of the children are an instance of SelectItemGroup, render them as a nested table. Each of the children are ultimately rendererd as follows. Render a "label" element with the "for" attribute being the clientId of the component. Inside of the "label", render an "input" element of "type" "checkbox". The clientId is rendered as the value of the "name" and "id" attributes. The value of the current SelectItem is rendered as the value of the "value" attribute. If the value of the enclosing UISelectMany matches the current value, render "checked" as the value of the "checked" attribute. If the current SelectItem.isDisabled() returns true, render "disabled" as the value of the "disabled" attribute. Close out the "input" element and render the return value from SelectItem.getLabel(). Close out the "label" element and any other nested elements. CheckboxList &selectmanycheckboxlist-renderer-class; &core-attrs; &events-attrs; &i18n-attrs;
the layout for this list, either PAGE_DIRECTION or LINE_DIRECTION

InputTextarea
javax.faces.component.html.HtmlInputTextarea

When rendering a UIInput, Renders an HTML "input" element of "type" "text". Render the clientId of the component as the value of the "name" attribute. Render the current value of the component as the value of the "value" attribute. If the "styleClass" attribute is specified, render its value as the value of the "class" attribute. When rendering a UIOutput, if the "styleClass" or "style" attributes are present, render a "span" element. If the "styleClass" attribute is present, render its value as the value of the "class" attribute. If the "style" attribute is present, pass it thru. If the "escape" attribute is not present, or it is present and its value is "true" all angle brackets should be converted to the ampersand xx semicolon syntax when rendering the value of the "value" attribute as the value of the component. If the "escape" attribute is present and is "false" the value of the component should be rendered as the value of the "value" attribute without escaping.
